name: The Regency Hotel Solihull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an early flight from Birmingham and most other hotels had no vacancy at the time we booked, so, despite poor reviews, we ended up at the Corus. It was much better than we had anticipated; we had a large family room (although only paid for a double) which was quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful and although we didn't eat at the hotel there is an excellent restaurant only 15 minutes drive away (The Forest at Dorridge).
reviews.title: The owners of this place need to take a long hard look at themselves

reviews.text: We used the pool/sauna facilities and found them fine. I think the main problems reported relate to the fact that the hotel is a little dated (redecoration work was evident in some parts when we were there.
reviews.title: Truly awfull

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week whilst visiting the area. Would never stay again.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable hotel

reviews.text: Where do I start? Decor in reception, lounge and corridors is dated (but did see painters in a corridor at one point). Bar is a soulless cavern full of locals getting smashed while listening to TV dance music channels at earbashing levels. Equipment in gym is a disgrace - only about 2 or 3 weight machines were actually working, the rest were all rusty or needed retuned, pedals on cycle machines were snapped, water machine was broken and the smell of chlorine from the pool area was overbearing.
reviews.title: Over priced and poor standards

reviews.text: I stayed here with work on a cuple of occassions. The rooms were dark and smelled of smoke. The food was ok but took time to arrive. The staff were dim and you could never get a straight answer out of them. I'm glad that I did not pay for this it is a cheap hotel that smells of chlorine on a main road.
reviews.title: basic and drab

likes.liked: — smoke smell in the dark rooms

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for seven nights.
reviews.title: Basic standard fayre with poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It provided an adequate room with the facilities I would expect for this class of hotel, but that said the walls were painfully thin and I could hear what the rest of the corridor was up to. The bed was comfy and the room well kept.
reviews.title: Grotty

reviews.text: Breakfast was hit or miss, the food was very reasonable with a buffet style service. But the problems came with what should of been easy provision of tea coffee and toast. Only once did they get this right first time and once I was completely ignored and left with none!
reviews.title: Out of tune Corus

reviews.text: The regency bar downstairs was very well presented with friendly staff and reasonably priced food.
reviews.title: In Corus – Altogether Now – I will not, I will not return.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Corus Hotel in Solihull on business on 17 October 2007 and it was one of the most horrible hotel experiences I have had in many years. Because of the Camping and Caravanning Exhibition at the NEC that week all Birmingham hotels were really busy and the only hotel with availability was the Corus and now I know why.
reviews.title: Most awful hotel experience for years

description: This impressive hotel is built around an elaborate, large Victorian home which was later converted into the Regency Club. The hotel is surrounded by lovely grounds and yet is just a short drive from the motorway network and Birmingham. It is minutes away from the NEC and Birmingham International Airport.Meeting rooms are modern, well-equipped and versatile, suitable for conferences, seminars, training courses and all benefit from natural daylight and air conditioning. The hotel also has excellent health and leisure facilities and a great restaurant, bar and pub, perfect for unwinding at the end of a long day.
